title: Theatre of Voices
description: Embodying 'undivided devotion to the musical material,' the Grammy Award–winning vocal ensemble Theatre of Voices is a go-to collaborator for many of today’s top composers. In this performance—in the intimate, in-the-round Zankel Hall Center Stage configuration—they sing a world premiere by the category-defying Julia Wolfe, a US premiere by John Luther Adams, and a recent work by Michael Gordon.
address: Zankel Hall Center Stage, Carnegie Hall

title: Ensemble Connect
description: Experience the versatility of Carnegie Hall’s Ensemble Connect in this intimate Weill Recital Hall performance. The program features Schubert’s “Quartettsatz,” two New York premieres by Katherine Balch, Berio’s Ricorrenze, and Beethoven’s Septet in E-flat Major. Enjoy an evening of remarkable music and contemporary compositions. Join us for a free drink at a post-concert reception in Weill Recital Hall’s Jacobs Room.
